posts.title: Nike's Upcoming Colourways For The Air Max Sunder Are Probably The Best Drops of This Year
posts.excerpt: Persian Violet & Realtree Camo will go down as the best drops of the year.
posts.body:
The Nike Air Max Sunder continues its comeback with two standout colourways that are turning heads in the sneaker world: Persian Violet and Realtree Camo.

The Persian Violet edition delivers a bold, expressive look with a vivid purple gradient across the upper. Its tie-dye-inspired effect makes it a statement piece, perfect for streetwear enthusiasts looking to add energy and personality to their outfits.

Meanwhile, the Realtree Camo colourway embraces rugged, outdoors-inspired aesthetics. Earthy browns and oranges in a camouflage pattern create a versatile, functional style that pairs effortlessly with casual and utility-focused outfits, making it ideal for autumn-ready fits.

Together, these colourways highlight the versatility of the Sunder silhouette. Where Persian Violet is bold and eye-catching, Realtree Camo is grounded and practical â€” both paying homage to the modelâ€™s late-â€™90s futuristic design while bringing it into modern streetwear culture.

â€”
cc: @Nike
#NikeAirMax #Sunder #SneakerRelease

posts.title: Prada & Oakley Design Next-Gen Spacesuit for NASA's Artemis III
posts.excerpt: Prada and Oakley join forces with Axiom Space to design NASAâ€™s Artemis III spacesuit â€” blending cutting-edge safety, innovation, and luxury design for a historic Moon mission in 2026.
posts.body:
Prada and Oakley have partnered with Axiom Space to create the next-generation spacesuit for NASAâ€™s upcoming Artemis III mission â€” which will send the first woman, person of color, and non-American to the Moonâ€™s south pole. ğŸª¡

Prada contributed its expertise in high-performance materials and precision design to develop a suit that is durable, functional, and visually striking. Meanwhile, Oakley is crafting advanced visors with enhanced optics and protection, ensuring astronauts have unparalleled visibility and safety in one of the harshest environments imaginable.

The result is a technologically advanced suit that merges safety, innovation, and fashion â€” a bold statement on how style can exist even in space. Every seam, material choice, and design detail serves a purpose, balancing form and function with astronaut mobility and comfort.

Set to be ready for the 2026 mission, the suit symbolizes how cross-industry collaboration can push human boundaries. Itâ€™s not just a leap forward for space exploration â€” itâ€™s a cultural moment that unites science, technology, and luxury design under one mission: to make history on the Moon.

posts.title: Pharrell's SS26 Louis Vuitton Puffer: A Statement Piece
posts.body:
I know and you know â€” this is probably a favourite piece from the Louis Vuitton SS26 collection. ğŸª¡

The standout? A rich green puffer jacket from the SS26 runway, part of Louis Vuittonâ€™s â€œglampingâ€-inspired collection designed by Pharrell Williams. The piece blends luxury craftsmanship with outdoor-ready utility, making it both a style statement and a functional garment.

Pharrellâ€™s vision for the collection plays with contrasts â€” opulent textures meet rugged silhouettes, while earthy tones balance the brandâ€™s signature refinement. The green puffer exemplifies this ethos, pairing exaggerated proportions with intricate detailing that rewards a closer look.

From front row whispers at #ParisFashionWeek to social media buzz, this jacket has quickly become the piece everyoneâ€™s talking about. Whether you see it as high-fashion art or an elevated winter essential, one thingâ€™s certain: Pharrellâ€™s Louis Vuitton is still rewriting the rules.

â€”
cc: @LouisVuitton
#ParisFashionWeek #PFW
posts.excerpt: Pharrell Williams makes a bold statement with his SS26 LV puffer jacket design. This article explores the design philosophy and cultural impact of this iconic piece.

posts.title: FC Barcelona x Kobe Bryant Brand: A Historic Collaboration
posts.body:
Spanish champions, FC Barcelona, have announced a collaboration with the brand of their good friend, NBA legend Kobe Bryant.

The collaboration reimagines team kits, blending BarÃ§aâ€™s iconic colors with sleek design elements inspired by Kobeâ€™s legacy. The collection features apparel as well as accessories, bringing together the worlds of basketball and football in a single, striking fashion statement. ğŸ–‡ï¸

This partnership goes beyond sportswear â€” itâ€™s a tribute to Kobeâ€™s competitive spirit and global influence. Every detail, from the placement of the crest to the use of premium fabrics, is meant to symbolize excellence and ambition, values shared by both FC Barcelona and Kobeâ€™s brand.

Collectors and fans can expect limited-edition drops, with some pieces designed to be future classics. From training jackets to streetwear-ready sneakers, the range offers something for both die-hard BarÃ§a supporters and Kobe fans worldwide. The collaboration is expected to debut in select flagship stores and online later this year.
posts.excerpt: An unprecedented collaboration brings together the worlds of football and basketball. This article explores the story behind the FC Barcelona and Kobe Bryant brand partnership.

posts.title: Editor's Edit: Outlander Magazine for PUMA
posts.excerpt: A deep dive into the stunning fashion collaboration between Outlander Magazine and Puma. We analyze the creative direction and style of this unique feature.
posts.body:
ï»¿

The â€˜Editorâ€™s Editâ€™ series â€” a space for ongoing discourse, built through the revision and response to opinions and arguments formed by other publications. ğŸ—ï¸

For our first edition, we look to Outlander Magazine (London), who recently gave flowers to Puma for consistently championing younger designers and smaller brands.

We highlight how creative freedom has become Pumaâ€™s core language â€” an approach that has helped the brand flourish in both the fashion and sportswear spheres. By allowing collaborators to bring their own DNA into projects, Puma sidesteps the cookie-cutter approach and instead delivers collections that feel relevant, experimental, and culturally plugged-in.

This commitment to collaboration has paid off: from limited-edition drops with underground creatives to reimagining archival pieces with fresh perspectives, Puma has kept its output unpredictable yet authentic. Itâ€™s a strategy that not only strengthens brand identity but also builds a community that feels seen, heard, and celebrated.

In a landscape where global sportswear giants often play it safe, Pumaâ€™s willingness to share the stage â€” and let new voices lead the narrative â€” might just be its most powerful move yet.

posts.title: Yamukela's Styling Masterclass on Sportscene Campaign
posts.body:
ï»¿

@yamborghin1 is the future. One of South Africaâ€™s biggest fashion retailers, Sportscene, tapped Yamukela to style its winter campaign in collaboration with iD â€“ Impahla Department. The result is a season-defining story that threads together streetwear credibility and retail polish. ğŸª¡

Credits
Director & Producer: @hypaveli
Photography: @eastrambo.jpeg
BTS Videographer: @aarontad_
Stylist: @impahladepartment
Models: @malaikajoness & @gr8fvl

This campaign doesnâ€™t just showcase clothing â€” it frames a cultural moment. Layered textures, modern tailoring, and a focus on individuality reflect a shift in how South African retail approaches fashion. By giving Yamukela creative control, Sportscene signals its trust in the new guard of stylists shaping the countryâ€™s visual language.

Why It Matters

  • Fresh perspective â€” emerging talent steering the visual narrative of major retailers.
  • Editorial quality â€” campaigns that could live in magazines but sell on the shop floor.
  • Cross-medium execution â€” clean production across photography, video, and social media.

From casting to color palette, the Sportscene winter story proves that local talent can lead on both creative and commercial fronts â€” without losing its edge.
posts.excerpt: Stylist Yamukela once again proves his expertise with a stunning campaign for Sportscene. We break down the key looks and the creative process.

posts.title: The Rise of South Africa's Sonic Pioneers
posts.excerpt: We shine a spotlight on the emerging artists who are shaping the sound of South Africa. Discover the stories behind the music and the future of the local scene.
posts.body:
Itâ€™s no secret that the newest generation of what used to be considered underground is now shaping the future sound of South African hip-hop. At the forefront of this shift are Brotherkupa and Jaykatana â€” two names that deserve the spotlight, alongside other rising talents in the scene.

Their music blends raw lyricism with experimental production, creating a sound thatâ€™s as rooted in SAâ€™s urban realities as it is ambitious in reaching global ears. Both artists are unafraid to challenge the status quo, pushing the sonic boundaries of what hip-hop can be in 2025.

Brotherkupaâ€™s storytelling resonates with authenticity, painting vivid portraits of township life while weaving in clever wordplay and unexpected flows. Jaykatana, on the other hand, delivers an energy that feels both unpredictable and magnetic â€” the kind of presence that commands attention whether on stage or in the booth.

With social media amplifying their reach and a growing fanbase eager for fresh sounds, Brotherkupa and Jaykatana stand as proof that the next wave of SA hip-hop is already here. Their rise signals a new chapter for the genre â€” one defined by originality, innovation, and unapologetic self-expression.

posts.title: Let's Face It - Tyla Hate Is So Forced.
posts.body:
Since her global breakthrough with the chart-topping single â€œWaterâ€, Tyla has cemented herself as one of the brightest stars in the amapiano and Afro-pop scene. With co-signs and collaborations alongside Travis Scott, Wizkid, Gunna and more, sheâ€™s clearly here for the long run.

But with fame comes scrutiny. In the U.S. â€” particularly within the Black American community â€” Tylaâ€™s identity has been questioned. By publicly aligning herself with the Coloured community, a South African ethnic group with mixed heritage rooted in European, African, and Asian ancestry, she has faced criticism for not identifying as Black.

This cultural debate has shaped how her music is perceived. Some have been quick to label her latest project a â€œflop.â€ But hereâ€™s the twist: the so-called â€œalbumâ€ in question is actually WWP, a four-track EP featuring just two singles (â€œBlissâ€ and â€œIs Itâ€). So â€” EPs are albums now? Even if we play along and call it one, the numbers tell a different story.

Sure, WWP sold only 3,700 units in the U.S. â€” modest by old-school standards. Yet on streaming platforms, the project is thriving: over 60 million Spotify streams to date, with nearly 12 million in its first week. The standout single â€œDynamiteâ€ (feat. Wizkid) scored the highest debut of the year on the Billboard U.S. Afrobeats chart, while critics backed the music too â€” NME rated the EP 4/5.

So, did Tyla flop? Not even close. WWP may be short and playful, but itâ€™s backed by streams, charts, and cultural impact â€” proving Tylaâ€™s momentum is only getting stronger.
posts.excerpt: Tylaâ€™s â€˜Flopâ€™ Debate: Numbers, Identity, and Misunderstanding

posts.title: The Vince Staples Show Returns For Season 2.
posts.excerpt: Netlfix Original 'The Vince Staples Show' returns for an anticipated second season this November.
posts.body:
The Vince Staples Show Returns: Season 2 Drops November 6

Netflix brings Vince Staples back with a genre-bending, surrealist comedy that follows a fictionalized Vince navigating everyday absurdity. Season 2 lands on November 6, 2025 with six new episodes.

What to expect: A road trip through grief and identity after Uncle Jamesâ€™s death, with a bigger spotlight on Vinceâ€™s familyâ€”his mother (Vanessa Bell Calloway) and sister (NatÃ© Jones). The season leans into anxiety, humor, and unpredictable scenarios (yes, including a mysterious dinner party).

Behind the show: Created by Vince Staples with Ian Edelman and Maurice Williams, and executive produced by Staples, Kenya Barris, and Corey Smyth, the series stays sharp, distinctive, and unapologetically weird.

Mark your calendars: November 6, 2025 â€” more humor, more heart, and more surreal chaos.

posts.title: Manchester United x DramaCall - The collaboration of the season.
posts.excerpt: The football giants join forces with DramaCall - one of the UK brands to look out for this year.
posts.body:
Drama Call Ã— Manchester United: A Fusion of Football Legacy and Streetwear Culture

The collaboration between Manchester United and local streetwear brand Drama Call is a powerful blend of football history and modern fashion. In partnership with adidas, the release centers on a bold reinterpretation of the clubâ€™s iconic 1988â€“90 away kit. The jersey maintains the classic blue colorway, Sharp sponsor, and vintage adidas accents while adding Drama Callâ€™s unique touchâ€”such as a sparkle motif, their logo, and a back print that reads "Drama 1988â€¯2023" instead of a traditional player name and number.

The campaign kicked off with â€œMade in Manchesterâ€ posters around the city and a creative teaser video showing Drama Callâ€™s mascot skateboarding past Old Trafford, eventually linking up with Fred the Red. The collaboration also featured star players like Marcus Rashford, Alessia Russo, and Leah Galton, reinforcing its authenticity and connection to the clubâ€™s identity.

This isnâ€™t just a fashion dropâ€”itâ€™s a cultural moment. By merging the global influence of Manchester United with the homegrown creativity of Drama Call, the partnership highlights Manchesterâ€™s ability to create globally resonant yet locally rooted work. With adidas providing design credibility, the collection appeals to fans of football, streetwear, and Mancunian pride alike.

Celebrating 12 Years of S.W.A.N.K

S.W.A.N.K marks a milestone with its 12-year celebrationâ€”an event that blends music, culture, and community in signature style. Attendees gather to honor more than a decade of creativity and consistency from a brand that stands as a cornerstone in Johannesburgâ€™s lifestyle and entertainment scene.

The celebration is not just about looking back; it signals the brandâ€™s ongoing ability to stay relevant, fresh, and connected to its audience. From live performances to a vibrant crowd, the atmosphere reflects S.W.A.N.Kâ€™s legacy of curating experiences that resonate.

Twelve years is no small feat, and this celebration stands as proof of vision, dedication, and culture-driven innovation.
posts.excerpt: S.W.A.N.K WORLD EXPERIENCE CELEBRATES OVER A DECADE OF RUNNING THE STREETWEAR GAME OF JOZI.
posts.title: S.W.A.N.K WORLD EXPERIENCE CELEBRATES 12 YEARS DEEP.
A$AP ROCKY'S MONCLER CAMPAIGN TEASES ALBUM DROP
posts.excerpt: A$AP Rockyâ€™s highly anticipated Moncler collaboration for Genius arrives with an album-hinting campaign.
posts.body:
A$AP Rocky â€” DONâ€™T BE DUMB

A$AP Rocky â€” DONâ€™T BE DUMB

First announced back in 2022, DONâ€™T BE DUMB is the long-awaited studio album from AWGE frontman A$AP Rocky. The project has carried heavy anticipation as a follow-up to TESTING, and as a milestone in Rockyâ€™s decade-long run at the intersection of style, sound, and culture.

Despite its August 2024 delay, fans have stayed locked in â€” dissecting singles, studying visuals, and piecing together every subtle clue. Rockyâ€™s rollout strategy has blurred the lines between music, fashion, and art, keeping the albumâ€™s mystique alive.

Now, Monclerâ€™s Genius campaign has injected fresh momentum into the conversation. Styled with Rockyâ€™s unmistakable fingerprints, the campaign slips in subtle cues that point to a possible imminent release. Far from a simple brand collaboration, the campaign reads like a coordinated prelude â€” an elegant bridge between luxury fashion and a major music release.

â€œThe campaign feels less like coincidence and more like the calm before the storm â€” a stylish prelude to what could be one of hip-hopâ€™s defining releases in recent years.â€

With fans hungry for a full-length record, the Moncler tie-in refocuses attention on Rockyâ€™s cultural sway and hints that DONâ€™T BE DUMB could be closer than anyone expected. Whether Monclerâ€™s visuals are a tease or a clear signal, the industry is watching â€” and the countdown has never felt more fashionably tense.

posts.title: Balatronstudio is bringing the family back together.
posts.excerpt: Donâ€™t ask too many questions, weâ€™ll meet on the 6th.
posts.body: This Saturday, Balatronstudio* brings Part 2 of its annual popup series to Rosebank, Johannesburg. Centered around community, the event will feature a curated performance lineup and the launch of a new collection.

Jonathan Anderson deserved to win Designer of the Year because he has once again proven himself to be one of fashionâ€™s most visionary, versatile, and influential creatives â€” and 2025 may have been his most ambitious year yet. First, under his leadership, his own label JW Anderson continues to challenge and expand the boundaries of what ready-to-wear can be: he treats runway shows as laboratories, blending sculptural construction, artisanal craft, and playful subversion to create clothing that defies easy categorization.

More significantly, 2025 marked his bold debut at Dior â€” now charged with overseeing both menswear and womenswear â€” and he used that platform to deliver a debut collection that both honored Diorâ€™s heritage and reinterpreted it through a contemporary, art-infused lens.

Meanwhile, his track record â€” which already includes transforming the Spanish house Loewe into a cultural powerhouse, redefining gender, form, and luxury in the process â€” shows that his talent is not fleeting but consistently capable of reshaping fashionâ€™s landscape.

In short: Andersonâ€™s win reflects not just a standout season, but a rare ability to combine commercial success, institutional prestige, and genuinely creative risk â€” making him, in 2025, the clearest choice for Designer of the Year.
posts.excerpt: For the third consecutive year, Jonathan Anderson bags 'Designer of the year' at the 2025 Fashion Awards.
posts.title: Jonathan Anderson Wins Designer of the Year (Again)
Ye is bring Yeezy to johannesburg with upcoming show
posts.excerpt: Ye delays Johannesburg show as it converts to full-scale Yeezy show.
posts.body:
Yeâ€™s highly anticipated Johannesburg show has been postponed as the team behind the event restructures it under the banner of Yeezy LLC. The decision comes after the original promoter was removed due to compliance issues, prompting a full reorganisation of the concert.

According to official statements, the show is being transformed into a bigger and more ambitious production, with new plans for the venue, stage design, and broadcast experience currently in the works. The team is taking the extra time to ensure that fans receive an upgraded and unforgettable performance that lives up to the hype surrounding Yeâ€™s arrival in South Africa.

All tickets for the original date have been refunded, confirming that the postponement is official. While fans will have to wait a little longer, the new schedule promises a more immersive and spectacular experience that will make the delay worth it. Updates on the rescheduled date are expected soon, so audiences are encouraged to stay tuned for announcements.

posts.title: Grace Wales Bonner Named British Menswear Designer of the Year
posts.excerpt: Grace Wales Bonner wins British Menswear Designer of the Year once again for her contributions to namesake label.
posts.body:
Grace Wales Bonner has once again been awarded the prestigious British Menswear Designer of the Year at The Fashion Awards 2025, marking a remarkable moment for British fashion. Since launching her eponymous label in 2014, Wales Bonner has developed a distinctive aesthetic that blends refined tailoring with cultural storytelling and global influences. Her collections explore themes of Black masculinity, Afroâ€‘Atlantic heritage, and fluid style, redefining menswear beyond traditional boundaries.

The 2025 award marks consecutive recognition, highlighting not just a standout collection, but sustained excellence and evolution in her work. Beyond the runway, Wales Bonnerâ€™s influence extends through collaborations with sportswear brands, culturally resonant pieces, and an intellectual rigor that elevates fashion to a medium for cultural conversation. Her designs resonate globally, cementing her role as an international tastemaker.

This year also brought a major career milestone: she was appointed creative director of menswear at HermÃ¨s, becoming the first Black woman to lead menâ€™s design at a major European luxury house. This historic appointment underscores the industryâ€™s confidence in her vision, and the award reaffirms her ability to shape the future of global menswear.
